dct_description_sm: Highly detailed topographic maps of Hokkaido, Japan, from 36th year of Meiji era (1903, Fourth printing).
Title taken/modified from index, Esan sheet (II,3 -- also includes legend).
Relief shown by contours and spot heights.
Shows topography (including grasslands, wetlands, vegetation, etc.), waterways, various land routes, various locations (mines, sites of battles, anchorages, lights, etc.), cities and towns.
In Japanese, with various place names in Latin script.
dct_rights_sm: Image from the Map Collections courtesy Stanford University Libraries. This item is in the public domain. There are no restrictions on use. If you have questions, please contact Branner Earth Sciences Library & Map Collections at brannerlibrary@stanford.edu.
